messages.content: Hi there, what can you tell me about network address translation?

Network address translation (NAT) is a technology to make it possible for a smaller number of public IP addresses to support a large number of private IP addresses. NAT is typically used to allow for remote devices (e.g. mobile phones, laptops, tablets, etc.) to connect to the internet while protecting the public IP address space of the internet service provider.
How does the router know which device on the LAN to send packets to?
The router uses the local IP address to route the packet to the appropriate device on the local network.
